result.execSummary:
The defendant Andre M Watkins was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: ***Note - deft spent 2 days in custody before bonding out of jail.***

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Andre M Watkins

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Bond applied; partial refund;  jk /mg   ck#16CH076202

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Kraus appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Rocco DeFilippis.  Case is resolved.  Amended information filed.  Information amended to include the prior offense which stems out of Cook County with a conviction date of 4/18/10.  Deft pleads guilty; found guilty by the Court.  Sentencing arguments made.  Deft fined $50 plus costs.  Bond to apply.  Balance to be returned to poster.  DNA ordered; notice given to deft.  Appeal rights.  NOTE - deft spent (2) days in custody before bonding out of jail
Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Kraus appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Rocco DeFilippis.  Attys request FPT/JS dates.  FPT 4/28/16 @ 11am, JS 6/6/16 @ 9am.
Status 4/8/16 @ 10:30am

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Kraus appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person.  Atty DeFilippis out on paternity leave at this time.  Status set for 4/8/16 @ 10:30am.  Deft provided the court with his contact information.

Email received from defense counsel requesting an adjournment of today's hrg (deft presently incarcerated in Illinois and discharge date is 1/25/16); no objection by the State.  Hrg adj to 2/4/16 @ 9:15am

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Atty Matt Perz appeared on behalf of deft.  Deft presently incarcerated in Illinois.  Arguments heard on deft's motion to quash warrant.  Deft's projected release date is January 25, 2016 per defense counsel.  Brief discussion held.  State takes no position on deft's request.  Court grants the deft's motion.  Warrant is vacated.  Cash bond of $1500 reinstated.  FP set for 11/16/15 @ 1:15pm.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Atty Christopher Rose appeared on behalf of deft.  State reports the deft is presently in prison in Illinois and his release date is January 25, 2017.  Atty Rose's motion to w/draw is granted.  BW authorized for deft; $2500 cash bond.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Atty Christopher Rose appeared on behalf of deft.  Atty Rose reports the deft's girlfriend contacted him to advise him the deft is incarcerated in Illinois.  Atty Rose's motion to w/draw taken under advisement.  State to attempt to locate the deft's whereabouts and his release date.  Status set for 7/21/15 @ 1:15pm

Warrant served, $2500 cash bond posted.  Return on warrant 4-23-15 at 1:00 before Intake Commissioner.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Atty Christopher Rose appeared on behalf of deft.  Deft presently in prison in Illinois.  State was unable to obtain a release date.  BW authorized; $2500 cash bond.  No bond forfeiture ordered at this time.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Drew Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Atty Chris Rose appeared on behalf of deft.  Atty Rose received a phone call from the deft's girlfriend stating the deft is incarcerated in Joliet at this time.  JT removed from the court's calendar.  Status set for 2/23/15 @ 1:15pm.

Attorney Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State. Def. appeared in court with Atty. Christopher Rose. Clerk LE.  Plea offer placed on the record by the State.  Prelim. waived, probable cause found. Bound over to Br. 3. Information filed, plea of not guilty. Judicial pretrial on 2-4-15 @ 9:00am. Jury selection on 2-23-15 @ 9:00am. Bond continued.
